info.description: GetAccept provides a sales enablement platform for sales to design, send, promote, track, and e-sign sales documents, leveraging sales collateral, contract management, proposals, and electronic signatures in one place.
info.title: GetAccept

get.description: Receive a list of available attachments. You can add new attachments in GetAccept using a new document.

parameters.description: A JSON object containing authentication credentials
parameters.name: body

client_id.description: The client id of your app if you received one from our API team

email.description: This is the email of the user in GetAccept

entity_id.description: This specifies what entity to select if multiple entities are available for a user. If no value is specified the default entity will be selected.

password.description: This is the password of the user in GetAccept

access_token.description: Token to be used in consequtive requests using bearer header

expires_in.description: Seconds until the access token expires

post.description:
Token based authentication is recommended for server-based access or access from clients where OAuth is not suitable. Access tokens has to be requested using an administrators login credentials.
Requests should include the header Content-Type with value application/json

get.description:
Receive a list of available contact for the current entity.
All contacts added as a recipient are saved as a contact and is available for later use on that entity.

parameters.description: A JSON object containing contact information
parameters.name: body

fullname.description: Use to specify full name instead of first/last name

title.description: The title of the contact, ex. CEO, Sales manager

post.description: This will create a new contact in the database for the current entity

parameters.description: An external ID is a custom field which can contain a unique record identifier from a system outside of GetAccept
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description: Start list from record x until limit
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Get a list of available documents

parameters.description: A JSON object containing document information
parameters.name: body

id.description: Attachment ID received from list or after upload

require_view.description: Require that recipient view the attachment

type.description: file or external where file is an uploaded file and external is a link to an external file

expiration_date.description: Date and time when the document should expire

file_ids.description: Comma-separated, unique file-ids received when uploading files

file_url.description: Url to document file. Documents must be public available for download

is_automatic_sending.description: If the document should be sent after creation

is_scheduled_sending.description: Should the sending be scheduled for sending in the future

is_signing.description: Should the document be sent for signing

is_signing_forward.description: Should recipients be able to transfer signature rights

is_sms_sending.description: Should the document be sent to recipient mobile by text

name.description: Enter a name of the document

role.description: The kind of recipient in the document

role_name.description: The name of the role in a template

verify_eid_type.description: EID type to be used for personal verification

verify_qna_open.description: Should question be asked before opening document

verify_qna_sign.description: Should a question be asked before signing

verify_sms_sign.description: Should a SMS verify the recipient before signing

scheduled_sending_time.description: Date and time when the document should be sent out

sender_email.description: Send from other email than authenticated user

sender_id.description: Send from other user than authenticated

template_id.description: Select a template to use for the sending

type.description: Set the type/category of the document

video_id.description: Select a video to use for the sending

post.description:
You must create a document to be able to send it to a recipient. When creating a document you can refer to previously uploaded files with file_id or you can choose to create a document and upload the files in on API post. You can only upload ONE file when including a file in the create document POST.

Use either file_ids parameter to use existing uploaded file(s), file_content to send the document as base64 encoded string or do a multipart post with file parameter.

All recipients must have either a valid e-mail or a mobile number.

All events are recorded using requestor IP address. You can override this using header CLIENT_IP containing the end-users public IP address.
post.summary: Create and send document or template

404.description: The specified resource was not found

get.description: Get document details by specifying a document id.

404.description: The specified resource was not found

get.description:
Document file can always be downloaded but most likely you want to download it when it has status Signed. 

You can select to receive a download-url or get the binary file.

The download URL is accessable 10 minutes after a request has been made.

404.description: The specified resource was not found

get.description: Get a list of fields for a document or template. Can be used both before and after a document has been signed.

404.description: The specified resource was not found

get.description: Get a list of recipients for a specific document.

parameters.description: An optional JSON object containing seal information
parameters.name: body

sender_email.description: Use this to specify the sender user/owner by email address to be used for self-signing the document.

sender_id.description: Use this to specify the sender user/owner by id to be used for self-signing the document.

404.description: The specified resource was not found

post.description:
If you prefer to send the document manually you can use this method to seal the document. Do not use this method if you send the document automatically or if you use the send document method above.

This API call triggers the document seal action and can only be performed on documents with document_status = draft. The method will return individual access/signing links for each recipient.

If document was created using self-sign option it will also be self-signed by the authenticated or specified user before sealing.

parameters.description: An optional JSON object containing sending information
parameters.name: body

sender_email.description: Use this to specify the sender user/owner by email address to be used for self-signing the document.

sender_id.description: Use this to specify the sender user/owner by id to be used for self-signing the document.

404.description: The specified resource was not found

post.description:
When you send a document via GetAccept, we deliver an email to all recipients, each containing a unique, secured link. This API call triggers the document send action and can only be performed on documents with document_status = draft. The document will be sent to recipients you provided when it was created.

If document was created using self-sign option it will also be self-signed by the authenticated or specified user before sending.

get.description: You can request a refreshed of the access token before the original token has expired.

parameters.description: A JSON object containing subscription information
parameters.name: body

host.description: The host name to send the post to

global.description: If the webhook should catch events for all entity users.

notification_email.description: If the event fails, send a notification to this email instead of the sender

target_url.description: The URL to post payload to on event

post.description:
This call will create a new subscription.
The response will be wrapped in an array even for single object according to REST hook standards.

>Events
  * `document.created` - Document is created
  * `document.sent` - Document is sent
  * `document.viewed` - Document is sent
  * `document.signed` - Document is signed
  * `document.approved` - Document is approved
  * `document.expired` - Document has expired
  * `document.rejected` - Document is rejected
  * `document.downloaded` - Document is downloaded
  * `document.printed` - Document is printed
  * `document.forwarded` - Document is forwarded
  * `document.partially_signed` - Document has been partially signed
  * `document.commented` - Document is commented
  * `document.hardbounced` - Document is hardbounced
  * `document.imported` - Document is imported
post.x-ms-trigger-hint: Trigger when a document status is changed

get.description: Receive a list of roles for a specific template.

parameters.description: Filename of the document, with the extension. This will be helpful for converting different file-types.
parameters.name: file_name

file_id.description: ID of the uploaded file to be used in file_ids when creating a document

post.description:
You can upload one file at a time and get a file id. The file id is used to connect a file with a GetAccept document which is sent to recipients. If you want to upload mutliple files you run multiple POST. We only accept files up to 10 MB as default. Uploaded file need to be imported/added to a document within 48 hours after uploading.

We recommended you to upload PDF files in order to guarantee the same look when sent. Other file types can be converted, such as:

Mirosoft Office: doc, docx, xl, xls, xlsx, ppt, pptx
Mac: numbers, key
Images: jpg, jpeg, png
Other: html, tex, csv

parameters.description: Filename of the document, with the extension. This will be helpful for converting different file-types.
parameters.name: file_name

id.description: ID of the uploaded attachment to be used in attachment_id when creating a document

post.description:
You can upload attachment files to include with documents you send.
Successful request will return the attachment_id. Use attachment_id to assign an attachment to a document.

parameters.description: Filename of the video, with the extension. This will be helpful for converting different file-types.
parameters.name: file_name

job_id.description: Id of the processing job converting and compressing the video. Poll for job status updates using /video/job/<ID>.

video_id.description: ID of the uploaded video to be used in video_id when creating a document

post.description:
You can upload attachment files to include with documents you send.
Successful request will return the attachment_id. Use attachment_id to assign an attachment to a document.

This call will return details of a single user.
Receive details and available entities of the current authenticated user using user-id *me*
Receive a list of available videos on the entity. You can add new videos in the mobile app or inside GetAccept.

Document.description: A document is one or multiple uploaded file(s) that is to be sent to one or many recipients created by a user.
Document.title: Document

Recipient.description: Every unique e-mail address (or mobile number) that is connected to a document is a recipient.

document_url.description: Unique URL for the recipient to view/sign

Recipient.title: Recipient

User.description:
A user is defined by its e-mail address and is connected to one or many entities.

### User Roles

#### Administrator:
- View all documents
- Edit all documents
- Change entity settings, info and billing
- Add new users to the entity
- Assign entity roles

#### Manager:
- View team documents
- Edit all documents
- Add new users to the entity

## Entity
An entity is the top node and all users and corresponding documents are connected to an entity. An entity is often the same as a company, a country or a department in a large organization.

title.description: The title of the user, ex. CEO, Sales manager

User.title: User

Oauth2.description: For testing purpose, use client_id **api** and client_secret **app**

tags.description: Authentication with the GetAccept API can be made using JWT tokens (JSON Web Tokens) or OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework http://oauth.net/2/  All requests must be made via HTTPS. All configuration URLs (webhooks, etc) should begin with https:// as well.
tags.name: Authentication

tags.description: To simplify the process of checking a documents status and make it more efficient in an integrated application, you can enable API Webhooks. Enable webhooks as a user with administrator privileges in the Settings | Integration | Webhooks. We support multiple webhooks for one application. Events will be POSTed to your webhook URLs and should be handled by you. A POST must be answered and your endpoint will need to return a 2xx HTTP. Otherwise, the callback will be considered a failure and will be retried later. Retries will be made after 1, 12, 24, and 48 hours. The sender (or notification_email) will receive an email notification after a failed attempt.
tags.name: Subscriptions

tags.description: GetAccept has extensive support for creating templates in different formats. You can use form fields to receive input data from a recipient or word files to merge custom data into a document.
tags.name: Templates

tags.description: General user methods for creating, listing of users, single user details and statistics and managing existing users.
tags.name: Users

tags.description: You can upload an attachment and reuse it in many documents.
tags.name: Attachments
